  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Populates matrices and vectors with data from a txt file, prints the data that was parsed, and then runs simulations to test whether the system is in a safe state and whether it can process an incoming request and remain in a safe state.
      Parameters:
      args - String array of command line arguments

    • requestLessOrEqualToNeed

      public static boolean requestLessOrEqualToNeed​(ArrayList<Integer> request, Matrix need) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks whether a process requested within its maximum allowed processes. This is the first step in the Resource-Request Algorithm for a Process Pi.
      Parameters:
      request - Vector of process requester and resources
      need - Matrix of process needed to reach max
      Returns:
      boolean TRUE if request ≤ need
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Process requested more resources than its max

    • allocateProcessResources

      public static void allocateProcessResources​(ArrayList<Integer> request, ArrayList<Integer> available, Matrix allocation, Matrix need)
      Allocates resources to a process and updates the count of available resources.
      Parameters:
      request - Vector of process requester and resources
      available - Vector of available resources
      allocation - Matrix of resources allocated to a process
      need - Matrix of process needed to reach max

    • awaitResources

      public static boolean awaitResources​(ArrayList<Integer> request, ArrayList<Integer> available, Matrix allocation, Matrix max, Matrix need)
      Checks whether there are enough resources for the request, if not it must wait, and it goes through a simulation seeing which processes can release their resources. After each process releases its resources it checks whether there are enough resources now. Finally, it returns the status of the allocation of resources to requester.
      Parameters:
      request - Vector of process requester and resources
      available - Vector of available resources
      allocation - Matrix of resources allocated to a process
      max - Matrix of maximum resources to a process
      need - Matrix of resources needed to reach max
      Returns:
      boolean TRUE if resources were allocated to requester

    • sumUntilZero

      public static int sumUntilZero​(int number)
      Calculates the sum of a number added to itself and subtracting 1 until that number is 0. This is used to calculate the maximum number of loops required to give each process time to either wait/release its resources. In the worst case scenario this is how many loops would be required to release all resources.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to sum until 0
      Returns:
      int

    • willProcessReleaseResources

      public static boolean willProcessReleaseResources​(int process_index, Matrix allocation, Matrix need, ArrayList<Integer> available)
      Checks if there are enough available resources for a process to return all of its resources back to the available vector. Returns the status of whether it was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      process_index - The process attempting to release its resources
      allocation - Matrix of resources allocated to a process
      need - Matrix of resources needed to reach max
      available - Vector of available resources
      Returns:
      boolean TRUE if process released its resources

    • checkSystemSafety

      public static void checkSystemSafety​(Matrix allocation, Matrix need, ArrayList<Integer> available)
      Check system safety by seeing if all resources can be released, sometimes a process may not have enough resources, so it will have to wait for resources to be free, this will need to loop. The maximum number of loops needed to check if resources can be released. Max number of loops will be = to the number of process in the Matrix.
      Parameters:
      allocation - n x m Matrix of allocation
      need - n x m Matrix of need
      available - 1 x m Vector of available processes

    • resourcesRemainInMatrix

      public static boolean resourcesRemainInMatrix​(Matrix matrix)
      Return TRUE if matrix is not 0 for every resource.
      Parameters:
      matrix - A process x resource Matrix
      Returns:
      boolean

    • systemIsSafe

      public static boolean systemIsSafe​(Matrix allocation, Matrix need, ArrayList<Integer> available)
      Return TRUE if all resources from allocation can be returned to available resource vector.
      Parameters:
      allocation - An n x m Matrix of allocation
      need - An n x m Matrix of need
      available - A 1 x m Vector of available processes
      Returns:
      boolean

    • printVector

      public static void printVector​(String title, ArrayList<Integer> vector)
      Outputs to console the Integers stored in the vector parameter.
      Parameters:
      title - A title to signify the name of the vector
      vector - An ArrayList of integers length of Matrix.resources

    • allValuesLessThanOrEqual

      public static boolean allValuesLessThanOrEqual​(ArrayList<Integer> list1, ArrayList<Integer> list2)
      Return TRUE if all values in list1 <= need. This is used for Request <= Need, AND, Request <= Available. Refer to Step 1 on Slide 28 of 43 in ch07_v01 Deadlocks.
      Parameters:
      list1 - The count of each process requested to use
      list2 - ector of initially claimed resources to reach max for process that requested
      Returns:
      boolean

    • populateVectorFromString

      public static void populateVectorFromString​(ArrayList<Integer> vector, String line)
      Populate a vector with values from a txt file that are seperated by either ":" or " ".
      Parameters:
      vector - The vector to populate with integers
      line - A string containing numbers

    • printRequest

      public static void printRequest​(ArrayList<Integer> vector)
      Output the contents of a 1D vector
      Parameters:
      vector - The vector to be displayed in console
